children.name: a group of people who work together
team a2
children.partOfSpeech: [c noun with sg or pl verb]
children.definition: team a group of people who work together to do a job:
examples: there will be a meeting for all members of the team next wednesday.
dr gaultier and his medical team worked in the refugee camps for over a year.
team of
the coins were discovered by a team of archaeologists.
the prime minister works closely with a team of unelected advisers.
a teamofinvestigators

children.name: committee b2
children.partOfSpeech: [c noun with sg or pl verb]
children.definition: committee a small group of people in an organization who have been chosen to make official decisions: ủy ban
examples: bill dean has been elected chairman of the committee.
finance/ health/ housing etc committee
the finance committee has decided to raise membership fees for next season.
be on a committeebe a member of a committee
she’s been on the church committee for 20 years.
shesits on/is onthe school's development committee.

children.name: board c1
children.partOfSpeech: [c noun with sg or pl verb]
children.definition: board a group of people in an organization or company who make rules and decisions about how the organization works, give permission for particular plans to be carried out etc : ban, bộ, hội đồng ban
examples: the licensing board has refused us permission to sell alcohol on the premises.
in october, the school board recommended that uniforms become compulsory.
board of examiners/ governors/ directors etc
if you don’t agree with the result, you can appeal to the board of examiners.

children.name: panel c1
children.partOfSpeech: [c noun with sg or pl verb]
children.definition: panel a group of people who have been chosen to give advice or their opinion or to make an official decision about sth, usually because they know a lot about it : ban hội thẩm
examples: i’ve been invited to join the panel on a radio arts programme.
panel of
all applicants are questioned by a panel of experienced interviewers.
he was on a panel of judges for a famous literary prize.
the competition will be judged by a panelofexperts.

children.name: working group x
children.definition: working group/workingparty  a group of people chosen to consider a particular problem in detail and to suggest how to deal with it : nhóm làm việc
examples: a police force working party concluded that many people found the police intimidating.
a working party was set up to investigate and act on the report’s findings.

children.name: unit c1
children.partOfSpeech: [c noun with sg or pl verb]
children.definition: unit an official group that has been formed to work together to do a particular job or be responsible for a particular problem: đơn vị
examples: hospital officials plan to use the donations to set up a new cardiac unit.
one of the policemen from the drug unit will be visiting local schools.

children.name: a group of two or three people
couple b1
children.definition: couple two people who are together, especially because they are married or have a sexual relationship: cặp (tình nhân)
examples: the couple who live next door to me
a young couple were walking hand in hand along the beach.
anelderlycouple uk live/ us lives next door.
should the government do more to helpyoungcouples buy their own homes?
a married couplea couple who are married : cặp vợ chồng
the house was bought by a young married couple.

children.name: pair x
children.definition: pair two people who are doing something together, or who are similar or connected in some way : cặp (giống nhau)
examples: pair of
they felt like a pair of burglars, enjoying themselves in someone else’s house while the owner was away.
in pairsworking in groups of two : theo cặp
do the next exercise in pairs.
a strange/ funny/ friendly etc pair :
bill and his brother were a rather odd-looking pair.

children.name: trio c2
children.definition: trionoun pluraltrios
examples: [ c + singular or plural verb ]
a group of three people or things
_there was disappointment for our trioof200 metre runners, all of whom failed to reach the final.

children.name: duo x
children.definition: duo two people who work or perform together: bộ đôi
examples: a brilliant young comedy duo
the successful management duo of doug livermore and ray clemence

children.name: a group of people together in one place
crowd a2
children.definition: crowd a large number of people who are all together in the same place: đám đông
examples: a huge crowd gathered to hear mandela speak.
crowd of
a crowd of reporters were waiting for her at the airport.
a crowd of about 15,000 attended the concert.
crowds of people/ tourists/ shoppers etca lot of people in the same place
i walked down regent street with its crowds of tourists and christmas shoppers.

children.name: group a1
children.definition: group several people who are together in the same place:
examples: a small group had gathered outside the stage door.
group of
outside the school, little groups of friends were talking to each other.
an old photograph of a group of soldiers sitting on the ground.
in groupsforming separate groups : theo từng nhóm
men stood in groups on street corners.
get into groupsmake groups with other people so that you can do sth together : tạo thành nhóm
the teacher told us to get into groups of three.

children.name: cluster u
children.definition: cluster a group of people standing or sitting very close to each other, for example in order to see something or talk to sb: đám, bầy
examples: cluster of
a cluster of people, all anxious to shake his hand, formed around the speaker.
some relatives were standing in a cluster around her hospital bed.

children.name: knot x
children.definition: knot a small group of people all sitting or standing very close to each other: nhóm người, tốp người
examples: knot of
knotsofanxious people stood waiting in the hall.
the knot of men at the bar had started talking about the elections.
outside the hotel, a little knot of bystanders had gathered to see what was happening.

children.name: a group of people who do things together
bunch b1/ crowd a2
children.definition: bunch/ crowd/bʌntʃ, kraʊd/  especiallyspoken, informal a group of people who do things together or spend time together:
examples: lũ , bọn, tụi
▪ the people on my french course are a really friendly bunch.
các học viên dự khóa học tiếng pháp của tôi đều là những đứa rất thân thiện.
bunch/ crowd of
những người, đám
▪ there was the usual crowd of students standing at the bar.
có một đám học sinh bình thường đang đứng ở quầy bar.
▪ willy’s band is playing tonight, and i invited a bunch of people to come along.
nhóm nhạc của willy sẽ chơi nhạc tối nay, nên tôi đã rủ một đám người đến cùng.
bunchnoungroup
[ c ] a number of things of the same type fastened together or in a close group
_a bunch of flowers/grapes/bananas/keys
_mainlyusinformalthe reorganization will give usa wholebunch (= a lot)ofproblems.

children.name: party x
children.definition: party a group of people that sb has organized in order to go somewhere or do sth: đội , nhóm
examples: a party of japanese businessmen will be visiting the factory next week.
party of
john was taking a party of tourists around the museum.
a search/ rescue partya group of people trying to find and help someone who is in danger
the climbers did not return, and a search party was sent out to look for them.

children.name: gang b2
children.partOfSpeech: [countable noun with singular or plural verb in british english]
children.definition: gang/gæŋ/  a group of young people who spend time together, especially a group thatcausestrouble,fightswith other groups etc:
examples: băng nhóm
▪ inner-city kids often join gangs for protection, and for the chance to make money by selling drugs.
những đứa trẻ sống ở trung tâm thành phố thường gia nhập vào các băng đảng để tự bảo vệ, và thừa cơ kiếm tiền bằng việc buôn lậu ma túy.
gang of youths/ kids
băng nhóm vị thành niên, đám nít ranh
▪ there are always gangs of kids hanging around the shopping mall.
luôn có những đám nít ranh loanh quanh trung tâm mua sắm.
gang member/ leader
trưởng băng nhóm, tên cầm đầu
▪ it is not just gang members who get into trouble - it’s middle-class and upper-class kids as well.
không chỉ những đứa gia nhập băng đảng - mà những đứa trẻ thuộc tầng lớp trung lưu và thượng lưu cũng gặp rắc rối.
rival ganga gang that fights with another gang
băng đối thủ
▪ fighting broke out between two rival gangs.
cuộc ẩu đả đã nổ ra giữa hai băng đảng đối địch.
gangnoun[ c + sing/pl verb ]
a group of young people, especially young men, who spend time together, oftenfighting with other groups and behaving badly
_fights among rival gangs account for most murders in the city.

children.name: group a1
children.definition: group nhóm
examples: the tickets are expensive, but there is a discount for school groups.
group of
a group of us went out for a drink to celebrate sonia’s birthday.
in groups
robberies were common on the lonely roads, so people usually travelled in groups.
in groups of three/ four etc
we were warned not to walk in the mountains except in groups of three or more.

children.name: contingent x
children.definition: contingent a group of people representing a particular country, organization, belief etc: nhóm người có chung những đặc trưng riêng
examples: not surprisingly, there was a large student contingent at the demonstration.
there was a large american contingent, including the olympic bronze medallist, thomas jefferson.
contingent of
a small contingent of english fans had made the trip to sydney to support their team.

children.name: a group of people who are similar or have similar ideas
movement c1
children.definition: movement a large groupof people who share the same ideas and beliefs, and who work together to achieve sth important: phong trào
examples: she was active in a number of political movements, including the campaign to end slavery.
the national liberation movement
a movementtostop animals being killed for their fur
the peace/ environmental/ women’s etc movement
one of the leaders of the pro-democracy movement has been arrested.
the aim of the civil rights movement was to eliminate racial discrimination in all its forms.

children.name: group a1
children.definition: group a number of people who are similar in some way, or who have the same ideas and aims: nhóm người (có chung suy nghĩ)
examples: their policy was to keep demonstrators from different political groups apart.
group of
the factory was burned down by a group of animal-rights activists.

children.name: lot x
children.definition: lot   a group of people - use this especially about people that you do not like or do not approve of : đám
examples: i don’t like her new friends - they’re a snobbish lot.
lot of
we’ve got another lot of visitors coming this weekend.
that lotuse this to show disapproval spoken
don’t take any notice of that lot, they’re just ignorant.

children.name: collection x
children.definition: collection/ assortment a group of people, especially people who you think are strange or unusual: nhóm người (lạ)
examples: collection/ assortment of
there was an interesting collection of people at the wedding.
jack brought an odd collection of characters home from the racetrack.
we shared the train compartment with an odd assortment of fellow travellers.

children.name: element x
children.definition: element
examples: the criminal/student/fascist etc element

[a group of people who have the same ideas, aims, beliefs etc that are different from those of a larger group - use this especially about people you do not like or agree with] nhóm người, những thành phần
the chief had been warned that there were criminal elements within the security police.
they seem to be trying to get rid of all left-wing elements in the party.
the committee agreed on the need to get rid of the hooligan element amongst football supporters.

children.name: school x
children.definition: school a group of artists, writers etc who share the same ideas, style of work etc: hội, giới
examples: there is no denying the influence of the impressionist school in his painting.
he seems to be very much part of the marxist school in his approach to politics.
school of
the impressionist schoolofpainting
school of thoughta group of people who believe in the same theory, idea etc : trường phái
one school of thought argues that introducing stiffer penalties would bring the crime rate down.

children.name: circle b2
children.definition: circle
examples: literary/ political/ academic etc circles[people who work in or are interested in literature, politics etc] giới (văn học, chính trị.....)
by 1920 she had written two novels, and had succeeded in winning recognition in literary circles.
it was the 1960s, and the military had become unpopular among academic and intellectual circles.

children.name: batch x
children.definition: batch a group of people who are all dealt with together at the same time, for example because they are all starting sth together: nhóm người
examples: batch of
the latest batch of new recruits had just arrived at the camp.

children.name: a group of people who are the same age, have the same income etc
group a1
children.definition: group
examples: age/ income/ blood etc group[a group of people with the same age, income, blood type etc]
the good thing about the class is that all the students belong to the same age group.
families in the lowest income group could not afford to educate their children.
the hospital is desperate for donors from the rhesus negative blood group.

children.name: bracket c1
children.definition: bracket
examples: an tax/ income/ age etc bracket
[people who are considered as a group, especially for official or financial purposes, because they have the same income, are of similar age etc] nhóm, lứa
several companies have produced pension plans specifically for people in the higher income tax bracket.

children.name: band x
children.definition: band
examples: an income/ tax/ age etc band[a group of people whose income, tax, or age comes within a particular range] băng; toán; tốp; đội
these changes will not affect people in the lowest tax band.
as you move into the higher income bands, the charges start to increase.

children.name: a small group of people unwilling to let other people join them
clique x
children.definition: clique a small group of people who like the same things and are very friendly with each other but who do not want other people to join them: bọn, phường, tụi, bè lũ
examples: most of the kids were friendly, apart from a clique of girls who came from rich families.
a clique of literary friends who thought they were so superior
cliquey[adj] spoken: bè lũ
the tennis club has good facilities, but it’s terribly cliquey.

children.name: elite c1
children.definition: elite a group of people who are the richest, most powerful, best educated etc in society, and who do not want others to share their advantages: nhóm người xuất sắc, ưu tú, được xã hội trọng dụng
examples: only a small elite can afford to send their children to this school.
all the glamorous washington elite were at the dinner that evening.
elite[adj] ưu tú
anyone who studied at the college joined an elite band of well-connected lawyers, doctors and businessmen.

children.name: in-crowd x
children.definition: in-crowd a small group of people who are admired by others because they are very fashionable, or who know things that other people do not, and who it is difficult to become friendly with: hội (sành điệu, hiểu biết nhiều, nổi tiếng)
examples: that’s the nightclub where all the in-crowd go.
he wanted to be accepted, to be part of the in-crowd.
within the political in-crowd are some extremely influential figures.

children.name: a small group within a larger political or religious organization
faction x
children.definition: faction  a group of people within a larger political or religious organization who have different aims from many of the other people within it: bè phái
examples: the pro-war faction within the party condemned any attempt at negotiation.
the whole of the country has been taken over and destroyed by warring factions.

children.name: fringe x
children.definition: fringe a group of people in a political or religious organization who have ideas that most people in the organization do not agree with or think are extreme: phần tử cực đoan
examples: the terrorist fringe condemned the decision and threatened to use force.
crusading journalist william lloyd garrison represented the radical fringe.
lunatic fringepeople with very extreme, stupid ideas : thành phần cực đoan quá khích
a lunatic fringe of cranks and reactionaries, who probably still believe that the earth is flat.

children.name: splinter group x
children.definition: splinter group a small group of people who leave a larger political or religious group to form their own smaller group, because they do not agree with the larger group’s beliefs, aims, methods etc: nhóm ly khai
examples: they broke away and formed a splinter group that believed in revolution, not gradual change.
the splinter group rapidly gained support from discontented members.
the socialist workers' party seemed to split into several splinter groups.

children.name: force b2
children.definition: force a group of people organized and trained to do a particular job, especially for military, police or a stated purpose : lực lượng
examples: the security forces
the work force
he joined thepoliceforce straight after school.

children.name: side b2
children.definition: sidenounopposing group
examples: [ c + singular or plural verb ]one of two or more opposing teams or groups
_this is a war which neither side can win.
_our side (= team) lost again on saturday.
_whose/which side are youon(= which team are you playing for/supporting) ?
_don't be angry with me - i'monyour side (= i want to help you) .

children.name: a group of people chosen to be surveyed
sample b2
children.definition: sample a group of people that is chosen out of a larger number and is asked questions or tested in order to get information about the larger group : nhóm người làm mẫu
examples: 56% of the women in the sample said that they supported the government’s policies.
random sampleone that is chosen completely by chance, not according to a plan
these responses were drawn from a random sample of the electorate.
representative sample one that is designed to contain a balance of different types of people
she based her analysis on data from a representative sample of women and men aged 18-25.

children.name: focus group x
children.definition: focus group a small group of ordinary people who are chosen to give their opinions about a particular product or idea, in order to help the organization that supplies it to know what the public wants or thinks: nhóm khảo sát
examples: we use focus groups, surveys, and questionnaires to try to gauge our customers’ needs.
focus groups revealed that teenagers who had higher self-confidence were more likely to use contraception.
